required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase III Study of Abatacept in Patients With Rheumatoid Arthritis and an Inadequate Response to Methotrexate
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Abatacept Administered Intravenously in Korean Subjects With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis While Receiving Methotrexate

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to demonstrate the clinical efficacy of abatacept (body-weight tiered dose approximating 10 mg/kg) compared with placebo on a background of methotrexate after 6 months (Day 169) of treatment in Korean patients with active rheumatoid arthritis and an inadequate clinical response to methotrexate

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Meeting the Criteria of the American College of Rheumatology for 20% Improvement (ACR20)
primary_outcome.description: The ACR 20 is based on 20% improvement (compared with baseline values) in tender and swollen joint counts and on 20% improvement in 3 of the remaining 5 core set measures (participant global assessment of pain, participant global assessment of disease activity, physician global assessment of disease activity, participant assessment of physical function) and 1 acute phase reactant value.

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term Extension (LTE) (Open-Label) Period: Number of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Related SAEs, Discontinuatons Due to SAEs, Adverse Events (AEs), Related AEs, and Discontinuations Due to AEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 169 to up to 56 days post the last dose (Day 1485) in the LTE period
primary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a preexisting medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Related AE=relationship of certain, probable, possible, or missing. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With American College of Rheumatology (ACR) ACR50 and ACR70 Response at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: The ACR defines ACR 50 and ACR70 response as a 50% or 70% improvement (compared with baseline values) in tender and swollen joint counts and 50% or 70% improvement in 3 of the remaining 5 core set measures (patient global assessment of pain, patient global assessment of disease activity, physician global assessment of disease activity, subject assessment of physical function) and 1 acute phase reactant value (C-reactive protein).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With at Least 20%, 50%, or 70% Improvement From Baseline in American College of Rheumatology (ACR) Core Components
secondary_outcome.description: The ACR defines improvement in core components as 20%, 50%, or 70% improvement in tender and swollen joint counts and 3 of the remaining core components: patient global assessment of disease activity, physician global assessment of disease activity, patient assessment of pain, patient self-assessed disability (Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index [HAQ-DI]), and levels of 1 acute phase reactant (C-reactive protein levels or erythrocyte sedimentation rate.) The HAQ-DI assesses a patient's level of functional ability via 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning; scale=0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled); total possible score=24. The higher the score, the greater the disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Disease Activity Scores (DAS) Based on C-reactive Protein (DAS 28 [CRP]) Levels or Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (DAS 28[ESR])
secondary_outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline. The DAS28 provides a score on a scale from 0 to 10 indicating the current activity of rheumatoid arthritis (>5.1=high disease activity; <3.2=low disease activity; <2.6=remission). CRP or ESR give estimations of DAS28 values on a group level. Change from Baseline=Postbaseline - Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 169 in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline. The HAQ-DI assesses a patient's level of functional ability via 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning. Patients respond on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled); total possible score=24. Higher score indicates greater disability. Change from baseline= postbaseline - baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Day 169 in Analysis of Short-Form 36 (SF-36) Health Survey Questionnaire Domains
secondary_outcome.description: Adjusted mean change from baseline. The SF-36 is a 36-item self-administered questionnaire developed to assess health-related quality of life and comprised of 8 domains( including 4 physical and 4 mental subscales) used to derive the physical and mental component summary scores. All subscales were scored using norm-based methods that standardized the scores to a mean of 50 and a standard deviation of 10 in the general population. The scores range from 0 to 100, with a higher score indicating better quality of life. Change from baseline=postbaseline - baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Deaths, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Adverse Events (AEs), Related SAEs and AEs, and Discontinuations Due to SAEs and AEs During the Double-Blind Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout double-blind study period (up to Day 169); table includes data up to 56 days past double-blind period or start of the open-label period, whichever occurred first.
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a preexisting medical condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Related AE=relationship of certain, probable, possible, or missing. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) and Half-Life of Elimination (T-Half)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of infusion and 2 to 4 hours after the start of infusion on Day 85, at anytime between Day 92 and 96, and pre-dose on Day 113
secondary_outcome.description: Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg. Tmax = the time after administration of a drug when the maximum plasma concentration is reached; when the rate of absorption equals the rate of elimination. T-Half = the biological half-life or elimination half life of a substance is the time it takes for a substance to lose half of its pharmacologic, physiologic, or radiologic activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters - Maximum Concentration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of infusion and 2 to 4 hours after the start of the infusion on Day 85, at anytime between Day 92 and 96, and pre-dose on Day 113
secondary_outcome.description: Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg. Maximum Concentration (Cmax)= the maximum plasma concentration of the drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters - Area Under the Curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of infusion, 2 to 4 hours after the start of infusion on Day 85, anytime between Day 92 and 96, and predose on Day 113
secondary_outcome.description: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve (AUC), a measure of drug absorption, in a dosing interval of 28 days from Day 85 to Day 113. Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters: Total Body Clearance (CLT)
secondary_outcome.description: Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg. Clearance is a pharmacokinetic parameter that describes how quickly drugs are eliminated, metabolized or distributed throughout the body.

secondary_outcome.measure: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters: Volume at Steady State (VSS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of infusion, 2 to 4 hours after the start of infusion on Day 85, anytime between Day 92 and 96, and predose on Day 113
secondary_outcome.description: The volume of distribution of drug at steady state (VSS). Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary Statistics of Minimum Observed Serum Concentration (Cmin) for Abatacept
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of infusion and 2 to 4 hours after the start of the infusion on Day 85
secondary_outcome.description: Minimum concentration (Cmin) of Abatacept 500 mg and 750 mg at given time points

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity of Abatacept- Number of Participants With Reactivity Toward CTLA4-IG and CTLA4-T at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity was determined by measuring adult subject sera for reactivity against the whole Abatacept molecule (CTLA4Ig) and CTLA4-T (CTLA4 without the Ig regions).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Surrogate Marker Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change in surrogate marker mean ESR. A surrogate marker is an indirect measurement of effectiveness. Change from Baseline = postbaseline - baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Surrogate Marker Rheumatoid Factor (RF) at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change in RF. A surrogate marker is an indirect measurement of effectiveness. Mean change from Baseline = postbaseline - baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: LTE Period: Overall Number of Participants With Positive Results of Immunogenicity Samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 169, at 6-month intervals on-treatment, and at Days 28, 56, and 85 after the last infusion of study medication in the LTE period
secondary_outcome.description: Positive antibody titers were identified by validated enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay results. On-treatment samples were obtained during the LTE period, and posttreatment samples were following the last infusion of study medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving ACR20, ACR50, and ACR70 Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: The ACR 20, ACR50, and ACR70 are based on 20%, 50% and 70% improvement, respectively, (compared with baseline values) in tender and swollen joint counts and on 20%, 50% and 70%, respectively, improvement in 3 of the remaining 5 core set measures (participant global assessment of pain, participant global assessment of disease activity, physician global assessment of disease activity, participant assessment of physical function) and 1 acute phase reactant value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Physical Function Response as Assessed Using the Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI)
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement is measured by an improved response of at least 0.3 units from baseline on the HAQ-DI score. The HAQ-DI assesses a patient's level of functional ability via 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning. Patients respond on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled); total possible score=24. Higher score indicates greater disability. Change from baseline= postbaseline - baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI) Score
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI assesses a patient's level of functional ability via 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning. Patients respond on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled); total possible score=24. Higher score indicates greater disability. Change from baseline= postbaseline - baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in Short-Form 36 (SF-36) Physical and Mental Health Summaries
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item questionnaire used to measure Quality of Life over 8 physically and emotionally based areas: physical functioning, role limitations due to physical health, role limitations due to emotional problems, energy/fatigue, emotional well-being, social functioning, pain, and general health. Answers to each question correspond to a precoded numeric value. An aggregate percentage score is reached for each of the 8 sections and is based on answers to questions. The mean average is worked out for each section. Scores range from 0% (lowest level of functioning) to 100% (highest level of functioning, with higher score indicated increasing levels of functioning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR)-Defined Low Disease Activity Score (LDAS) and With EULAR-defined Remission
secondary_outcome.description: EULAR defines LDAS as a disease activity score as measured by c-reactive protein (DAS28-CRP) ≤3.2 and remission as DAS28-CRP <2.6

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes From Baseline in the Simplified Disease Activity Index (SDAI) and the Clinical Disease Activity Index (CDAI) Scores
secondary_outcome.description: The SDAI is the sum of 5 parameters: Tender joint (TJC) and swollen joint(SJC)counts, based on a 28-joint assessment; patient global (PtGA)and physician global assessments (PGA), assessed on 0-10 cm visual analog scale (VAS), on which higher scores=greater affection due to disease activity DA); and C-reactive protein level. SDAI total score=0-86. SDAI <=3.3 indicates disease remission, >3.4 to 11=low DA, >11 to 26=moderate DA, and >26=high DA. SJC is assessed at each visit, with no swelling=0, swelling=1. TJC is assessed through identification of joints painful under pressure or to passive motion at each visit, with no tenderness=0, tenderness=1. Higher score=greater affection due to DA. CDAI is sum of 4 parameters: TJC and SJC (based on a 28-joint assessment), PtGA and PGA (assessed on 0-10 cm VAS; higher scores=greater affection due to disease activity). CDAI total score=0-76. CDAI <=2.8 indicates disease remission, >2.8 to 10=low DA, >10 to 22=moderate DA, and >22=high DA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Low Disease Activity Score (LDAS) or Who Are in Remission
secondary_outcome.description: LDAS is defined as a Disease Activity Score C-reactive protein (DAS28-CRP) level <=3.2. Remission is defined as a DAS28-CRP level <2.6.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Levels of C-reactive Protein (CRP)
Change From Baseline in Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate

intervention.description: Intravenous (IV) solution, - weight tiered (500 mg <60 kg); (750 mg 60-100 kg); (1 gram > 100 kg), Day 1, Day 15, Day 29; every 28 days thereafter, 6 months
IV solution, Intravenous, D5W, Day 1, Day 15, Day 29; every 28 days thereafter, 6 months
Tablets, oral, 15 mg weekly to be adjusted according to patient condition

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) for longer than 1 year from the time of the initial diagnosis of RA
- Patients must have been taking methotrexate for at least 3 months with at least a weekly dose of 15 mg, and a stable dose for 28 days prior to treatment (Day 1)
- Methotrexate weekly dose as low as 10 mg is permitted for patients who cannot tolerate higher doses
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence (as assessed by the Investigator) of active or latent bacterial or viral infections at the time of potential enrollment

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

clinical_study.keyword: Rheumatoid Arthritis, with inadequate response to methotrexate

group.title: Abatacept, 10 mg/kg
group.description: Short-term Period: Participants received a body-weight tiered dose of abatacept approximating 10 mg/kg. Study medication was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141 (6-month treatment). Long-term Period: Participants who completed the Short-term Period received treatment with abatacept, administered IV at a weight-tiered dose approximately 10 mg/kg.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo was administered IV on Days 1, 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141 (6-month treatment).

participants_list.participants: Participants who received placebo in this period received abatacept in next period.

group.title: Abatacept
group.description: Dosage: 500 mg to 1 g; participants randomized to the abatacept group received a body-weight tiered dose approximating 10 mg/kg. Study medication was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 15, and 29, and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141 (6 month treatment).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Study medication was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 15, and 29, and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141 (6 month treatment).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
measure.description: One participant was randomized to the abatacept arm but never treated, and is not included in baseline characteristics.

measure.title: weight

outcome.population: All randomized participants who received study drug.

outcome.title: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters - Area Under the Curve (AUC)
outcome.description: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve (AUC), a measure of drug absorption, in a dosing interval of 28 days from Day 85 to Day 113. Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg.
outcome.time_frame: At the end of infusion, 2 to 4 hours after the start of infusion on Day 85, anytime between Day 92 and 96, and predose on Day 113
outcome.population: Participants with measurement at stated dose level

measure.title: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters - Area Under the Curve (AUC)
measure.description: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve (AUC), a measure of drug absorption, in a dosing interval of 28 days from Day 85 to Day 113. Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg.
measure.population: Participants with measurement at stated dose level

outcome.title: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters: Total Body Clearance (CLT)
outcome.description: Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg. Clearance is a pharmacokinetic parameter that describes how quickly drugs are eliminated, metabolized or distributed throughout the body.
outcome.population: Participants with measurement at stated dose level

measure.title: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters: Total Body Clearance (CLT)
measure.description: Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg. Clearance is a pharmacokinetic parameter that describes how quickly drugs are eliminated, metabolized or distributed throughout the body.

outcome.title: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters: Volume at Steady State (VSS)

measure.title: Abatacept Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameters: Volume at Steady State (VSS)
measure.description: The volume of distribution of drug at steady state (VSS). Steady-state PK parameters following administration of body-weight tiered doses approximating 10 mg/kg.
measure.population: Participants with measurement at stated dose level

outcome.title: Summary Statistics of Minimum Observed Serum Concentration (Cmin) for Abatacept
outcome.description: Minimum concentration (Cmin) of Abatacept 500 mg and 750 mg at given time points
outcome.time_frame: At the end of infusion and 2 to 4 hours after the start of the infusion on Day 85
outcome.population: Participants with measurement at timepoint

measure.title: Summary Statistics of Minimum Observed Serum Concentration (Cmin) for Abatacept
measure.description: Minimum concentration (Cmin) of Abatacept 500 mg and 750 mg at given time points
measure.population: Participants with measurement at timepoint

outcome.title: Immunogenicity of Abatacept- Number of Participants With Reactivity Toward CTLA4-IG and CTLA4-T at Day 169
outcome.description: Immunogenicity was determined by measuring adult subject sera for reactivity against the whole Abatacept molecule (CTLA4Ig) and CTLA4-T (CTLA4 without the Ig regions).
outcome.population: All participants who received study drug (abatacept)

group.title: Abatacept + Background Methotrexate
group.description: Dosage: 500 mg to 1 g; subjects randomized to the abatacept group received a body-weight tiered dose approximating 10 mg/kg. Study medication was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 15, and 29, and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141 (6 month treatment).

measure.title: Immunogenicity of Abatacept- Number of Participants With Reactivity Toward CTLA4-IG and CTLA4-T at Day 169
measure.description: Immunogenicity was determined by measuring adult subject sera for reactivity against the whole Abatacept molecule (CTLA4Ig) and CTLA4-T (CTLA4 without the Ig regions).
measure.population: All participants who received study drug (abatacept)

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Surrogate Marker Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR) at Day 169
outcome.description: Mean change in surrogate marker mean ESR. A surrogate marker is an indirect measurement of effectiveness. Change from Baseline = postbaseline - baseline value.
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received study drug. Participants with baseline and post-baseline measurements were included, not the participants who had only baseline measurements.

group.title: Abatacept
group.description: Dosage: 500 mg to 1 g; participants randomized to the abatacept group received a body-weight tiered dose approximating 10 mg/kg. Study medication was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 15, and 29, and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141 (6 month treatment).

measure.description: Mean change in surrogate marker mean ESR. A surrogate marker is an indirect measurement of effectiveness. Change from Baseline = postbaseline - baseline value.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Surrogate Marker Rheumatoid Factor (RF) at Day 169

outcome.population: All Randomized and Treated Participants. The summary was based on the last observation carried forward (LOCF) procedure. Participants with baseline and post-baseline measurements were included, not the participants who had only baseline measurements.

measure.description: Mean change in RF. A surrogate marker is an indirect measurement of effectiveness. Mean change from Baseline = postbaseline - baseline value.

outcome.title: Long-term Extension (LTE) (Open-Label) Period: Number of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Related SAEs, Discontinuatons Due to SAEs, Adverse Events (AEs), Related AEs, and Discontinuations Due to AEs
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a preexisting medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Related AE=relationship of certain, probable, possible, or missing. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
outcome.time_frame: Day 169 to up to 56 days post the last dose (Day 1485) in the LTE period
outcome.population: All participants who completed the short-term period and received at least 1 infusion of abatacept during the LTE period

group.title: All Treated
group.description: Abatacept, administered intravenously IV monthly at a fixed dose of approximately 10 mg/kg for an average of approximately 41 months in the LTE period on a background of methotrexate

measure.title: Long-term Extension (LTE) (Open-Label) Period: Number of Participants With Death as Outcome, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Related SAEs, Discontinuatons Due to SAEs, Adverse Events (AEs), Related AEs, and Discontinuations Due to AEs
measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a preexisting medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Related AE=relationship of certain, probable, possible, or missing. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
measure.population: All participants who completed the short-term period and received at least 1 infusion of abatacept during the LTE period

outcome.title: LTE Period: Overall Number of Participants With Positive Results of Immunogenicity Samples
outcome.description: Positive antibody titers were identified by validated enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay results. On-treatment samples were obtained during the LTE period, and posttreatment samples were following the last infusion of study medication.
outcome.time_frame: Days 169, at 6-month intervals on-treatment, and at Days 28, 56, and 85 after the last infusion of study medication in the LTE period
outcome.population: All participants who during the LTE period, received at least 1 infusion of abatacept and had at least 1 immunogenicity sample collected.

group.title: All Treated
group.description: Abatacept was administered intravenously monthly at a fixed dose of approximately 10 mg/kg in the LTE period on a background of methotrexate

measure.title: LTE Period: Overall Number of Participants With Positive Results of Immunogenicity Samples
measure.description: Positive antibody titers were identified by validated enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay results. On-treatment samples were obtained during the LTE period, and posttreatment samples were following the last infusion of study medication.
measure.population: All participants who during the LTE period, received at least 1 infusion of abatacept and had at least 1 immunogenicity sample collected.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving ACR20, ACR50, and ACR70 Over Time
outcome.description: The ACR 20, ACR50, and ACR70 are based on 20%, 50% and 70% improvement, respectively, (compared with baseline values) in tender and swollen joint counts and on 20%, 50% and 70%, respectively, improvement in 3 of the remaining 5 core set measures (participant global assessment of pain, participant global assessment of disease activity, physician global assessment of disease activity, participant assessment of physical function) and 1 acute phase reactant value.
outcome.population: All participants who completed the ST period and received at least 1 infusion of abatacept during the LTE period. n=evaluable participants at that timepoint for that measure.

group.title: Abatacept, 10 mg/kg
group.description: Short-term Period: Abatacept administered IV in a body-weight tiered dose approximating 10 mg/kg. Study medication was administered on Days 1, 15, and 29, and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141. LTE Period: Abatacept, administered IV monthly at a fixed dose of approximately 10 mg/kg for an average of approximately 41 months on a background of methotrexate.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Short-term Period: Placebo administered IV on Days 1, 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141. LTE Period: Abatacept, administered IV monthly at a fixed dose of approximately 10 mg/kg for an average of approximately 41 months on a background of methotrexate.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving ACR20, ACR50, and ACR70 Over Time
measure.description: The ACR 20, ACR50, and ACR70 are based on 20%, 50% and 70% improvement, respectively, (compared with baseline values) in tender and swollen joint counts and on 20%, 50% and 70%, respectively, improvement in 3 of the remaining 5 core set measures (participant global assessment of pain, participant global assessment of disease activity, physician global assessment of disease activity, participant assessment of physical function) and 1 acute phase reactant value.
measure.population: All participants who completed the ST period and received at least 1 infusion of abatacept during the LTE period. n=evaluable participants at that timepoint for that measure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Physical Function Response as Assessed Using the Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI)
outcome.description: Improvement is measured by an improved response of at least 0.3 units from baseline on the HAQ-DI score. The HAQ-DI assesses a patient's level of functional ability via 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning. Patients respond on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled); total possible score=24. Higher score indicates greater disability. Change from baseline= postbaseline - baseline value.
outcome.population: All participants who received study drug and who were evaluable

group.title: Abatacept, 10 mg/kg
group.description: Short-term Period: Participants received a body-weight tiered dose of abatacept approximating 10 mg/kg. Study medication was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141. Long-term Period: Participants who completed the Short-term Period received treatment with abatacept, administered IV at a weight-tiered dose approximately 10 mg/kg.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Short-term Period: Placebo was administered IV on Days 1, 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141. Long-term Period: Participants who completed the Short-term Period received treatment with abatacept, administered IV at a weight-tiered dose approximately 10 mg/kg.

measure.description: Improvement is measured by an improved response of at least 0.3 units from baseline on the HAQ-DI score. The HAQ-DI assesses a patient's level of functional ability via 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning. Patients respond on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled); total possible score=24. Higher score indicates greater disability. Change from baseline= postbaseline - baseline value.
measure.population: All participants who received study drug and who were evaluable

outcome.description: The HAQ-DI assesses a patient's level of functional ability via 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning. measure.title: Change From Baseline in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI) Score
measure.description: The HAQ-DI assesses a patient's level of functional ability via 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning. Patients respond on a scale from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled); total possible score=24. Higher score indicates greater disability. Change from baseline= postbaseline - baseline value.
measure.population: All participants who received study drug and who were evaluable

outcome.title: Changes From Baseline in Short-Form 36 (SF-36) Physical and Mental Health Summaries
outcome.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item questionnaire used to measure Quality of Life over 8 physically and emotionally based areas: physical functioning, role limitations due to physical health, role limitations due to emotional problems, energy/fatigue, emotional well-being, social functioning, pain, and general health. Answers to each question correspond to a precoded numeric value. An aggregate percentage score is reached for each of the 8 sections and is based on answers to questions. The mean average is worked out for each section. Scores range from 0% (lowest level of functioning) to 100% (highest level of functioning, with higher score indicated increasing levels of functioning.
outcome.population: All participants who received study drug and who were evaluable

group.title: Abatacept, 10 mg/kg
group.description: Short-term Period: Participants received a body-weight tiered dose of abatacept approximating 10 mg/kg. Study medication was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141. Long-term Period: Participants who completed the Short-term Period received treatment with abatacept, administered IV at a weight-tiered dose approximately 10 mg/kg.

measure.title: Changes From Baseline in Short-Form 36 (SF-36) Physical and Mental Health Summaries
measure.description: The SF-36 is a 36-item questionnaire used to measure Quality of Life over 8 physically and emotionally based areas: physical functioning, role limitations due to physical health, role limitations due to emotional problems, energy/fatigue, emotional well-being, social functioning, pain, and general health. Answers to each question correspond to a precoded numeric value. An aggregate percentage score is reached for each of the 8 sections and is based on answers to questions. The mean average is worked out for each section. Scores range from 0% (lowest level of functioning) to 100% (highest level of functioning, with higher score indicated increasing levels of functioning.
measure.population: All participants who received study drug and who were evaluable

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR)-Defined Low Disease Activity Score (LDAS) and With EULAR-defined Remission
outcome.description: EULAR defines LDAS as a disease activity score as measured by c-reactive protein (DAS28-CRP) ≤3.2 and remission as DAS28-CRP <2.6
outcome.population: All participants who received study drug and who were evaluable

group.title: Abatacept, 10 mg/kg
group.description: Short-term Period: Participants received a body-weight tiered dose of abatacept approximating 10 mg/kg. Study medication was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141. Long-term Period: Participants who completed the Short-term Period received treatment with abatacept, administered IV at a weight-tiered dose approximately 10 mg/kg.

Long-term Period: Participants who completed the Short-term Period received treatment with abatacept, administered IV at a weight-tiered dose approximately 10 mg/kg.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR)-Defined Low Disease Activity Score (LDAS) and With EULAR-defined Remission
measure.description: EULAR defines LDAS as a disease activity score as measured by c-reactive protein (DAS28-CRP) ≤3.2 and remission as DAS28-CRP <2.6
measure.population: All participants who received study drug and who were evaluable

outcome.title: Changes From Baseline in the Simplified Disease Activity Index (SDAI) and the Clinical Disease Activity Index (CDAI) Scores
outcome.description: The SDAI is the sum of 5 parameters: Tender joint (TJC) and swollen joint(SJC)counts, based on a 28-joint assessment; patient global (PtGA)and physician global assessments (PGA), assessed on 0-10 cm visual analog scale (VAS), on which higher scores=greater affection due to disease activity DA); and C-reactive protein level. SDAI total score=0-86. SDAI <=3.3 indicates disease remission, >3.4 to 11=low DA, >11 to 26=moderate DA, and >26=high DA. SJC is assessed at each visit, with no swelling=0, swelling=1. TJC is assessed through identification of joints painful under pressure or to passive motion at each visit, with no tenderness=0, tenderness=1. Higher score=greater affection due to DA. CDAI is sum of 4 parameters: TJC and SJC (based on a 28-joint assessment), PtGA and PGA (assessed on 0-10 cm VAS; higher scores=greater affection due to disease activity). CDAI total score=0-76. CDAI <=2.8 indicates disease remission, >2.8 to 10=low DA, >10 to 22=moderate DA, and >22=high DA.
outcome.population: All participants who received study drug and who were evaluable

group.title: Abatacept, 10 mg/kg
group.description: Short-term Period: Participants received a body-weight tiered dose of abatacept approximating 10 mg/kg. Study medication was administered intravenously (IV) on Days 1, 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141. Long-term Period: Participants who completed the Short-term Period received treatment with abatacept, administered IV at a weight-tiered dose approximately 10 mg/kg.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Short-term Period: Participants received placebo IV on Days 1, 15, and 29 and every 28 days thereafter up to and including Day 141. Long-term Period: Participants who completed the Short-term Period received treatment with abatacept, administered IV at a weight-tiered dose approximately 10 mg/kg.

measure.title: Changes From Baseline in the Simplified Disease Activity Index (SDAI) and the Clinical Disease Activity Index (CDAI) Scores
measure.description: The SDAI is the sum of 5 parameters: Tender joint (TJC) and swollen joint(SJC)counts, based on a 28-joint assessment; patient global (PtGA)and physician global assessments (PGA), assessed on 0-10 cm visual analog scale (VAS), on which higher scores=greater affection due to disease activity DA); and C-reactive protein level. SDAI total score=0-86. SDAI <=3.3 indicates disease remission, >3.4 to 11=low DA, >11 to 26=moderate DA, and >26=high DA. SJC is assessed at each visit, with no swelling=0, swelling=1. TJC is assessed through identification of joints painful under pressure or to passive motion at each visit, with no tenderness=0, tenderness=1. Higher score=greater affection due to DA. CDAI is sum of 4 parameters: TJC and SJC (based on a 28-joint assessment), PtGA and PGA (assessed on 0-10 cm VAS; higher scores=greater affection due to disease activity). CDAI total score=0-76. CDAI <=2.8 indicates disease remission, >2.8 to 10=low DA, >10 to 22=moderate DA, and >22=high DA.
measure.population: All participants who received study drug and who were evaluable

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Low Disease Activity Score (LDAS) or Who Are in Remission
outcome.description: LDAS is defined as a Disease Activity Score C-reactive protein (DAS28-CRP) level <=3.2. Remission is defined as a DAS28-CRP level <2.6.
outcome.population: All participants who finished the Short-term period. n=Number of evaluable participants

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
